header.title: The Scroll of Set (Issue Number 56, Volume VI-2)
header.category: Western Esotericism, Occultism, Setianism, Black Magic

central_thesis: This issue of The Scroll of Set articulates the foundational philosophy and operative mechanics of Setian initiation and Black Magic, emphasizing individual self-creation (Xeper) through heightened awareness and directed will, distinguishing it from conventional occult practices, and providing internal insights into the Temple of Set's structure and core concepts for its members and prospective initiates.

structure_content.chapter_title: Remember the Old Lessons as You Learn the New
structure_content.summary: This article profiles Magister Lynn A. "Lee" Norton (Ptah), a key figure in the Temple of Set's Council of Nine. It details his background, journey into the Temple of Set, magical work (Tarot), and personal philosophies. He defines the Temple of Set as the exclusive path for serious Black Magicians seeking 'to Xeper ir Xem' and advises new Setians to master fundamental lessons before rushing to advanced ones.

structure_content.chapter_title: Initiation, Magic, & the Temple of Set
structure_content.summary: This comprehensive article redefines 'initiation' within the Temple of Set, moving beyond ritual to describe it as an internal process of awakening sensitivities and self-awareness, fundamental for understanding 'the Prince of Darkness' and transcending the natural order. It differentiates 'White Magic' (spells, devices) as crude from 'initiatory magic' which is a subtle, far-reaching application of will for evolutionary change (Xeper). The Temple is presented as an elitist, initiatory society, outlining the I° trial stage, Adept II°, and the ultimate goal of entering the 'realm of Darkness' to become a true initiatory magician.
An announcement recognizing Robert Menschel as a Priest of Set III°, signifying a high level of initiation and achievement within the Temple of Set.

A philosophical reflection, paraphrasing Nietzsche, on the internal struggles of the self, the 'twofold will' that seeks both transcendence ('Higher Man') and connection to humanity, and the inherent fear of greatness and the unknown.

structure_content.chapter_title: Editorial: I Get a Little Help from the Cosmic Ham
structure_content.summary: A meditation on the nature of self, existence, and the interconnectedness of macro and micro cosmos. The author asserts the individual self as the 'true denominator,' the 'creator,' and 'all,' highlighting the personal journey through universal existence.
A personal account of experiencing a profound realization of 'Freedom,' contrasting it with the perceived ignorance and hatred in the world, leading to a transformative perspective.
A brief, poetic narrative of an individual's journey from unknowing to self-discovery, finding the 'Black Flame,' and achieving understanding and self-affirmation ('I am').

A continuation of advice for Setians on their solitary path of self-evolution. It acknowledges the presence of guidance ('lights,' 'Flames,' 'strong ones') and encourages facing fear, recognizing it as a guide but not becoming enslaved by it, while striving for personal chosen path.

Another personal narrative similar to [7], detailing a journey from an uncomfortable state in the 'god-universe' to self-discovery and understanding through the 'Black Flame,' ultimately finding belonging and identity within Set and the Temple.

structure_content.chapter_title: Can we Control the Power Brokers?
structure_content.summary: This article analyzes global power dynamics, attributing conflicts to the pursuit of wealth and power. It identifies specific 'power brokers' (nations, institutions) and uses the Abortion Rights Mobilization suit against the Catholic Church as an example of challenging powerful entities, urging individuals to assert their influence as 'free electors'.

This piece defines 'faith' from a Setian perspective, drawing from 'Her-Bak.' It distinguishes between 'cerebral intelligence' and the 'intelligence of the heart' as different modes of understanding. Setian faith involves disengaging the brain's logical process to comprehend higher meanings and overcome dilemmas, leading to self-courage and the realization that 'Nothing is as it seems.' It also emphasizes trusting Priesthood guidance and working towards Xeper.

A technical article explaining why Greek names are commonly used for ancient Egyptian places and pharaohs instead of authentic Egyptian terms. It attributes this to linguistic imprecision, the repetition of Egyptian place names, and the Greek practice of renaming cities based on their attributes (e.g., 'Heliopolis' for sun worship, 'Crocodilopolis' for crocodile worship) to provide clarity.
An announcement recognizing Susan M. Wylie as a Priestess of Set III°, noting her entry into the Temple of Set and her subsequent recognition.

key_concepts.definition: The core Setian concept of self-creation, becoming, and evolution, striving to 'Xeper ir Xem' (I Create Myself to Grow). It represents the highest aspiration of a Black Magician within the Temple of Set.

Within the Temple of Set, this term refers to an individual whose primary aspiration is continuous self-creation and evolution (Xeper), distinct from practitioners of 'White Magic' focused on external effects.

Not a ritual event but a process of awakening inner sensitivities and self-awareness, enabling unique clarity in perceiving reality. It is an ongoing, self-driven evolution of the self, distinct from conventional magical training.

A subtle, far-reaching application of the initiate's will, stemming from an 'extraordinary perspective' gained through self-awareness. It aims to accomplish results and promote evolutionary change, contrasting with 'White Magic's' grosser application of psychic power.

A term used within the Temple of Set to describe the practice of using spells and other devices to concentrate and focus the will towards a desired end; considered 'crude' compared to the more subtle 'initiatory magic' of self-evolution.

A symbolic representation of the unique essence of the individual's self, attained through self-evolution and transcending the natural order. Finding and understanding the Black Flame is a key milestone in the Setian path.

A mode of understanding that bypasses conventional logical processes and 'cerebral intelligence.' It allows for the comprehension of higher meanings, symbols, and abstractions, leading to a deeper 'faith' and insight into truths beyond rational explanation.
Cosmic order, truth, and justice, referenced by a Setian priest as a guiding principle and witness when speaking truth from an impersonal source.

practical_system.description: The practical system outlined is one of radical self-transformation and self-creation (Xeper). It is an internal, ongoing process of 'self-initiation' achieved by cultivating an 'extraordinary perspective' and heightened self-awareness. The individual's will is applied subtly to effect evolutionary change, both within the self and potentially in their social context. The Temple of Set provides a framework for this journey, offering guidance through its Priesthood and structured degrees (I°, Adept II°, III°) that recognize attained states of initiation, rather than being mere ceremonial promotions.
tools: No specific external tools are prescribed for the core initiatory process. The 'Black Flame' is a conceptual inner attainment. While Tarot is mentioned as a skill of Magister Norton, it is not presented as a general tool for all Setians on their initiatory path. 'Spells and other devices' are categorized as 'White Magic,' which is deemed 'crude' in comparison to Setian initiatory magic.
rituals: Ceremonial magic is mentioned as a 'training device' for focusing the will, comparing it to kindergarten for initiatory magic. However, specific rituals are not detailed for the reader to perform. The emphasis is on the more subtle and internal 'initiatory magic' of self-evolution.

relevant_quotes.text: It is the only place to be if you are a serious Black Magician. I feel the Temple represents the true will of the Prince of Darkness and is the only current organization to do so. It means that what we are doing is real. It has substance. It works. It also means a lot of work. I have always had only one real aspiration: to be the best Black Magician that I possibly can. The rest is frosting on the cake - to Xeper ir Xem.

Do not be in such a hurry to learn the new lessons that you forget or fail to learn the old lessons. All are important. The old lessons, for instance to ‘question all things’, are the foundation upon which the new, more complex lessons are built.

Most precisely initiation is a process of awakening certain kinds of sensitivities within individuals which enable them to perceive situations, events, and patterns of social interaction with unique clarity and understanding of their actual significance and potential.
And initiation and magic are two sides of a single coin.

Initiatory magic is a far more subtle thing than the gross application of psychic power to affect a situation, and it is much more far-reaching in its effects. The initiate, from his extraordinary perspective, is able to learn and apply magic in a higher sense which is literally incomprehensible to non-initiates.
The only true denominator is myself. I am the creator. I am all.

... And my faith is a certainty that passes my understanding. "And you will never understand it. Such faith is the intelligence of the heart. This is another world than the world of thought, and the two cannot be transposed.

critical_analysis.relevance: This document is highly relevant for understanding the philosophical underpinnings and operative methods of the Temple of Set during a formative period (1980). It provides direct, internal definitions of core Setian concepts such as 'Initiation,' 'Black Magic,' and 'Xeper,' clarifying their meaning within the Setian context, often in contrast to more widely accepted occult interpretations. It elucidates the organization's structure, the role of its Priesthood, and the emphasis on individual self-evolution as the primary magical work. For researchers, it offers a primary source perspective on the ideological framework of a significant modern magical order.
critical_analysis.target_audience: The primary target audience is existing and prospective members of the Temple of Set, seeking to deepen their understanding of Setian philosophy, the initiatory path, and the practical application of Setian principles in their lives. Academics and practitioners of Western Esotericism, Occultism, and New Religious Movements would also find this document valuable for its insights into the unique cosmology and methodology of Setian Black Magic.
